product_info.usage:
2sum injection is an antibacterial vial treating a variety of bacterial infections occurring at different body organs. 2sum injection comes with the generic name of 'Ceftriaxone'. The medicine performs its function by inhibiting bacterial growth and cell wall formation.

Composition

The basic 2sum injection formula is a combination of 2 salts. Cefoperazone sodium and sulbactam sodium are the active components. Cefoperazone is included in the cephalosporins group of antibiotics. Sulbactam sodium comes in the 'beta-lactamase inhibitor' group of antibiotics. 

Uses

The detailed 2sum injection uses are listed below. The injection must be administered only on a doctor's prescription. It is advisable to use the injection only if you encounter any of the following conditions.

  • The 2sum injection is indicated in upper and lower respiratory tract infections.
  • The injection is also used to treat meningitis infection. Meningitis are the brain and spinal cord protective layer.
  • The injection is also used to treat pelvic infections.
  • The injection is used in the treatment of skin infections.
  • The injection also treats septicemia, which is a blood bacterial infection.
  • The 2sum injection also treats bacterial infections in bones and joints.
  • The injection also treats soft tissue infection.
  • The injection is also used to treat abdominal membrane infections called peritonitis and others.

It is used to treat a wide variety of bacterial infections (Such as Upper and lower respiratory and urinary tract infections, skin, soft tissue, bone and joint infections, septicemia, meningitis.

How to use 2sum injection

The injection is recommended to be injected intramuscularly or intravenously for effective results. The administration of injection must be under strict observation or by your doctor.

Dosage

The dosage is suggested as per the patient’s condition, age, and severity of infection. The recommended 2sum injection dose for adults is 2 to 4 grams which makes 1 to 2 injections per day. The recommended dosage for children is 40mg to 80mg per kg once a day.

Do not exceed the recommended dose to avoid any potential side effects. Do not miss a dose and avoid self-medicating yourself to avoid bacterial resistance.

Availability

The 2sum injection is readily available at any pharmacy and online store.

Price in Pakistan

The 2sum injection price in Pakistan is very reasonable and budget-friendly.
product_info.side_effects:
The complete 2sum injection side effects are listed below. Report to the doctor in case of prolonged and severe harmful effects.

  • Diarrhea as the injection can result in disturbance of natural microbiota of intestines.
  • Nausea.
  • Vomiting.
  • Painful urination.
  • Rashes and itching.
  • Fatigue and restlessness.
  • Chills.
  • Dizziness.
  • Stomach pain.
  • Swelling on your face, lips, tongue, or any other part.
  • Excessive gases in the stomach.
  • Neutrophilia (increased neutrophils level).
  • Eosinophilia (increased eosinophil count).
  • Headache.
  • Electrolyte imbalance.
product_info.precautions:
It is recommended to read all the precautionary measures before using the injection to avoid any harmful effects. The necessary 2sum injection precautions are listed below. 

  • Do not use the injection if you are allergic to any of its ingredients.
  • Notify your doctor of your medical history and previous allergies.
  • Brief your doctor about the medicines you are already using to avoid any cross-reaction and allergies.
  • Kidney patients need strict monitoring of dosage. Do not self-medicate yourself and notify your doctor. The dosage is recommended based on CrCl levels.
  • The injection can disturb the natural microbiota of large intestines. If you experience adverse effects consult a doctor.
  • Do not use the 2sum injection without a doctor's consultation if you are a liver patient.
  • Consult your physician before the administration of injection if you are pregnant.
  • Inform your doctor if you are allergic to cephalosporin or penicillin antibiotics.
  • The injection is not recommended to use during breastfeeding.
  • The 2sum injection needs to be used with extreme precaution in case of epilepsy.
  • Keep a check on electrolyte levels regularly.
  • Do not consume alcohol within 48 to 72 hours of usage.
  • Keep the injection away from the reach of children.
  • Place in a safe cool and dry place.

Use with caution having Kidney Disease and Liver Disease. It is not recommended in case of hypersensitivity.

product_info.usage:
2Blink is an ophthalmic solution containing polyethylene glycol 0.4% and propylene glycol 0.3%. This combination provides relief from dry eyes and irritation, as well as lubrication of the eye surface. 

The formulation is suitable for both adults and children.

Product Features: 

  • Relief from dry eyes and irritation.
  • Lubricates the eye surface.
  • Suitable for adults and children.
  • Non-irritant.
  • Ophthalmically tested.
  • Hypoallergenic.
  • No side effects.

Polyethylene Glycol 0.4% and Propylene Glycol 0.3%

Polyethylene glycol (PEG) is a clear liquid derived from ethylene oxide, a chemical compound. PEG is often used as a thickening agent in food products and cosmetics. 

Propylene glycol (PG) is a colorless, odorless, non-toxic, flammable liquid derived from propylene oxide. 

PG is commonly used in antifreeze solutions and coolants. Both PEG and PG are considered safe for use in humans.

Eye Lubricants

Eye lubricants are used to keep eyes moist and prevent dryness. Dry eyes can cause irritation and discomfort, especially if they become irritated. 

There are many different types of eye lubricants available, including saline solutions, artificial tears, and ointments. 

Saline solutions help to maintain moisture in the eyes and reduce the risk of infection. Artificial tears are designed to provide temporary relief from dry eyes. Ointments are often used to treat chronic conditions.

Dry Eyes Symptoms

Dry eye syndrome (DES) is a condition where the tears don’t flow properly due to tear film instability. 

There are many causes of DES including aging, allergies, autoimmune disease, medications, and environmental factors. Dry eye syndrome affects millions of people worldwide.

Symptoms of Dry Eye Syndrome

There are several different types of dry eye syndrome, however, they all have similar symptoms. These symptoms include:

  • Burning sensation
  • Itching
  • Gritty feeling
  • Stinging
  • Blurred vision
  • Tearing
  • Redness
  • Watery eyes

What Causes Dry Eyes?

Dry eye syndrome (DES) is a condition where tears do not flow properly out of the tear ducts. 

In some cases, the cause of DES may be due to environmental factors, such as air pollution, allergies, or even stress. Other times, the cause of DES is unknown. 

Symptoms of DES include irritation, burning, itching, redness, and sensitivity to light. If left untreated, DES can lead to serious complications including blurred vision, corneal ulcers, infections, and scarring.
product_info.side_effects: Vision may be temporarily blurred when this product is first used. Also, minor burning/stinging/irritation may temporarily occur. If any of these effects persist or worsen, tell your doctor or pharmacist promptly.
product_info.precautions:
Before using this product, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. 

This product (especially ointments) may temporarily cause blurred vision right after being placed in the eye(s). Do not drive, use machinery, or do any activity that requires clear vision until you are sure you can perform such activities safely. 

If you wear contact lenses, remove them before using most kinds of eye lubricants. Ask your doctor or pharmacist when you may replace your contact lenses. 

There are a few types of eye lubricants (some that contain polysorbates) that can be used while wearing contact lenses. Check the package to see if you can wear your contact lenses while using your product. 

If you are also using another kind of eye medication (e.g., drops or ointments), wait at least 5 minutes before applying other medications. 

Use eye drops before eye ointments to allow the eye drops to enter the eye. Before using this product, tell your doctor or pharmacist about all prescription and nonprescription/herbal products you may use especially other eye medications.

product_info.usage: This medication is used to treat severe cystic acne (also known as nodular acne) that has not responded to other treatment (e.g., benzoyl peroxide or clindamycin applied to the skin or tetracycline or minocycline taken by mouth).
product_info.side_effects: Dry lips and mouth, minor swelling of the eyelids or lips, crusty skin, nosebleeds, upset stomach, or thinning of hair may occur. If any of these effects persist or worsen, tell your doctor or pharmacist promptly.
product_info.precautions: Before taking isotretinoin, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or to vitamin A-related drugs (other retinoids such as tretinoin); or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients (such as soybean, parabens), which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Some people who are allergic to peanuts may also be allergic to soy. Talk to your pharmacist for more details.Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of diabetes, family or personal history of high blood fats (triglycerides), mental/mood problems (such as depression), liver disease, obesity, eating disorders (e.g., anorexia nervosa), alcohol abuse, pancreatitis, bone loss conditions (e.g., osteoporosis/osteomalacia, decreased bone density).Do not donate blood while you are taking isotretinoin and for at least 1 month after you stop taking it.This medication may make you more sensitive to the sun. Limit your time in the sun. Avoid tanning booths and sunlamps. Use sunscreen and wear protective clothing when outdoors.Tell your doctor right away if you get sunburned or have skin blisters/redness. Do not have cosmetic procedures to smooth your skin (e.g., waxing, laser, dermabrasion) during and for 6 months after isotretinoin therapy. Skin scarring may occur.Do not take isotretinoin if you are taking tetracycline antibiotics, such as doxycycline (Vibramycin) or demeclocycline (Declomycin, Declostatin, Ledermycin) or vitamin A. Avoid taking isotretinoin if you're taking Acitretin (Soriatane, Neotigason)

product_info.usage:
This Gel is in the form of an ointment and is used to treat acne scars. It helps to reduce acne pimples and also helps them heel faster. Tretinoin belongs to the retinoid class and works in the growth of the cells of the skin. Clindamycin is used to stop bacterial growth, which causes acne.

At the initial stage of its usage, the Gel works on pimples, and within a few days, you get rid of acne.

How to use

  • Read the leaflet carefully before using this medicine. If you have any questions, consult your doctor.
  • Before applying the medication, wash your hands. Gently clean your skin with a soap or cleanser and dap it for dry, and then use your fingers to apply this Gel in a thin layer on the affected area of your skin daily at bedtime.
  • Use this medication for your skin only. It is harmful to apply it on your lip area, eyes, and nose.
  • Do not apply it on cut, scratch, or skin affected from eczema.
  • Avoid gel contact with the eyes. If this happens to you, wash it with cold water. Seek medical attention urgently.
  • While you start using Gel, acne appears worse because it works on the pimples that found inside your skin. It may take a few weeks for the results.
  • Apply this Gel daily at one time each day. Do not apply it in a thick layer because it gives harm to your skin like redness and peeling.

Overdose

This medication became harmful when someone takes more than a prescription. It is harmful to the human body and its health. Without doctor's prescription do not use it according to your choice. Do not share this medication with others because everyone has different skin problems. 

If you forget this medication, use it when you remember. But if you forget to take medicine again, then wait for the medication schedule. 

Store it in room temperature and don’t freeze this medicine. Keep all medications away from children.

Interactions

Drug addictions change the medication's work and increase the chances of serious side effects. Do not use any medicine without the prescription of a doctor. 

This medication may interact with those products in which alcohol and menthol are added. Such as lotions and cleansers.

Benzoyl Peroxide can decrease the benefits of this medicine if you can use these products at the same time. Discuss the details about this medication with your doctor according to your medical history. Then they will better decide this medication is suitable for your health or not.

Availability

Acdermin Gel is available in all medical stores in Pakistan. The doctor recommends this Gel for acne scars and considers it one of the best products.
product_info.side_effects:
Every medicine, cream, or Gel has some side effects. A list of Acdermin Gel side effects are as follows:

  • Skin Redness
  • Dryness
  • Itching
  • Peeling
  • Mild Burning/ Stinging
  • Worsening of skin
  • Blistering
  • Crusting
  • Swelling of Skin
  • Abdominal pain
  • Diarrhoea
  • Cramping
  • Blood/Mucus

They affect your skin in the first few weeks of usage. If you can see these effects, consult to your doctor urgently.

Use it when your doctor prescribed you because they know how much benefit you get from this or not. Many people using this Gel don't get side effects.

This medicine is absorbed into your blood and causes severe bacteria. This situation may occur after you stopped using this medicine. Do not use acdermin Gel if you have the following symptoms because it makes worse conditions. 

An allergic reaction through this Gel is rare. If you have of allergic reaction on your face like swelling, and redness on the skin, seek immediate medical attention. 

If you see any other side effects, consult your doctor.
product_info.precautions:
When you start using this product, tell your doctor. This Gel contains ingredients, which cause severe allergic reactions. Before getting any medication, learn about the ingredients. If you have an allergy to clindamycin and Tretinoin, avoid using Acdermin gel. 

Do not use this medicine if you have problems, which cause colitis and diarrhoea and eczema. Immediately seek medical attention.

This medication is not suitable for the skin. It also provides you irritation from cold or wind. Use sunscreen daily when you are outside. Tell your doctor if you have sun blisters on your skin. Before using this product, wait until you are not recovering.

Avoid chemical and electronic products for hair removal while using Acdermin Gel. You will take this medication in Pregnancy when you need it. This drug passes it into your breast milk. It causes some diseases in an unborn baby. Discuss the actions of this medication with your doctor.
